brief.brief: A series of queries for Service Manager to run against the primary table in order to retrieve records for the report.
You can create any number of queries. If you define at least one stacked query, the sort field does not have to be a key.

detail.detail: If you use stacked queries, Service Manager creates a sortwork table is with the naming convention:
In this convention, xxx=the name of the primary table and mmddyyhhmmss defines the date and time that the sortwork table was created.
When you use stacked queries, change the primary file query to true because this is the query Service Manager uses to retrieve records from the sortwork table.
To obtain the best possible turnaround time for reports, ensure that all stacked queries are fully-keyed.
